Class RegularGraph

  • java.lang.Object
    • Outils.RegularGraph
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Graph

    public class RegularGraph
extends java.lang.Object
implements Graph
    Author:
    Christine Solnon

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RegularGraph(int n, int d, int min, int max)
      Creates a graph such that each vertex is connected to the next d vertices (modulo n) and such that the cost of each arc is a randomly chosen integer ranging between min and max
      RegularGraph(Noeud entrepot, java.util.Vector<PlageHoraire> plagesHoraires, Plan plan)

    • Constructor Detail

      • RegularGraph

        public RegularGraph(int n,
                    int d,
                    int min,
                    int max)
        Creates a graph such that each vertex is connected to the next d vertices (modulo n) and such that the cost of each arc is a randomly chosen integer ranging between min and max
        Parameters:
        n - a number of vertices such that n > 0
        d - a degree such that 0 < d < n
        min - a minimal arc cost such that 0 < min
        max - a maximal arc cost such that min < max

      • RegularGraph

                    Plan plan)

      • getCost

        public int[][] getCost()
        Specified by:
        getCost in interface Graph
        Returns:
        the cost matrix of this: for all vertices i and j, if (i,j) is an arc of this, then cost[i][j] = cost of (i,j), otherwise cost[i][j] = this.getMaxArcCost()+1
